case_vignette: A 16-year-old male with past medical history of mitral valve prolapse presents for evaluation of loose skin. Patient's parents report a several year history of stretchy skin, poor wound healing with some scars healing with thin overlying skin, and easy bruising. There is a family history of similar symptoms amongst other family members. Physical examination reveals soft, significantly extensible skin diffusely, multiple linear scars with atrophic overlying pink patches, and white-yellow papules along the bilateral inner and outer calcaneus upon standing. The patient is able to touch the tip of his nose with his tongue.  The patient's mother is a carrier of the genetic disorder that causes this condition.  The patient's father is not a carrier.  The patient's mother's sister is a carrier of the genetic disorder.  The patient's mother's brother is not a carrier.  The patient's mother's sister's daughter is a carrier of the genetic disorder.  The patient's mother's brother's son is not a carrier.  The patient's mother's sister's daughter's son is a carrier of the genetic disorder. multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have very stretchy skin, I bruise easily, and my wounds don't heal well, often leaving thin scars.
Do you have any joint issues, such as frequent dislocations or hypermobility?
I didn't mention any joint issues in my initial description of my symptoms.
Have you experienced any issues with your heart or blood vessels?
I have a history of mitral valve prolapse.
Do you have any family members with similar symptoms or diagnosed with a connective tissue disorder?
Yes, there is a family history of similar symptoms amongst other family members.
Final Diagnosis: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
